node.title: Pat Leahy, the Senateâ€™s longest-serving member, announces he will retire.
node.alt: Senator Patrick Leahy at the Capitol in October.
node.description: At age 81, the Vermont Democrat has served in the Senate for nearly half a century.
node.content: ["Senator Patrick J. Leahy, Democrat of Vermont and the chamber\u2019s longest-serving member, announced on Monday that he would retire at the end of his term rather than seeking re-election in 2022, closing out nearly half a century of service in Congress.", "Mr. Leahy, first elected in 1974 at age 34 after working as a prosecutor, announced his decision at a news conference in Montpelier, Vermont\u2019s capital.", "\u201cIt is time to pass the torch to the next Vermonter,\u201d Mr. Leahy, 81, said. \u201cIt is time to come home.\u201d", "The only sitting senator who served during President Gerald Ford\u2019s term, Mr. Leahy is the first and only registered Democrat to be elected to represent Vermont in the Senate. Mr. Leahy recently became the fourth longest-serving senator in American history, according to Senate records, and finishing his term at the end of 2022 will make him the third longest-serving.", "Mr. Leahy serves as president pro tempore of the Senate \u2014 a role reserved for the majority party\u2019s most senior member that puts him third in line to the presidency \u2014 and the chairman of the powerful Senate Appropriations Committee, which oversees government funding."]
